content: @Sean McIlvenna is there an equivalent format for a fhir structure definition for a CDA template that trifolia will pick up?
ToF understands StructureDefinition. Once we nail down the cda-core IG, I intend to load its StructureDefinitions into ToF to be used as a base for other implementation guides
I'm interested in the other stack, the classic CDA guides. If I write a structure definition on Observation as in CDA core, will that make it available in a classic CDA IG?
I have some import code for FHIR -> CDA in Trifoliw Workbench
but, it's largely unused... no idea how well it work
ok, people are about to get interested in this.
I especially doubt it will work with newer StructureDefinition concepts
some of the changes we've made to how "id" works in SD

I'm going to take the new CIMI IGs and generate profiles (/equivalent) and instances for

  • FHIR
  • CDA
  • V2
  • openEHR

as part of the IG
at least, for now, their observation derived stuff.
@Grahame Grieve Trifolia Workbench (aka the "old" Trifolia) has a native XML format for importing/exporting templates. It also has limited support for the Templates STU exchange format.
should I generate one of them then?
Do you have time to do that? :). If so I think it would be a great way to test the StructureDefinition approach. It would also allow publishing of IGs in legacy formats like MS Word.
